reviewText: If you have a craving for some contra-esque gameplay this will certainly satisfy the craving.\n\nThis game looks, plays, and feels extremely similiarly to the original Contra released way back when on the NES. There's even the flying football" power up holders
date: You can certainly feel that this game was made by people who loved Contra and wanted to recreate the joy they felt when they played.\n\nThe weapons are all the classic Contra 1 weapons
hoursPlayed: for machinegun which is basically a much faster and more powerful version of your basic gun
voteText: S spreadshot which is pretty self explanatory
helpfulPercent: E for electric shot which is a reskin of the original fire burst shot (and IMO makes more sense) and L for laser (Protip: rapidly hit the shot button with this weapon for DEVASTATING results). There's also a R powerup which adds rapidfire to whatever you're currently using. They added a couple of interesting twists
votesHelpful: the weapons all have alternate fire modes that are basically charged up power shots
votesTotal: and there are hidden power ups in the levels. (I have yet to find these "hidden powerups" but they're hinted at in the achievements.\n\nThere's both local and online coop which is a great feature
votesFunny: this kind of game is best enjoyed with a friend. Online coop is handled via user hosted lobbys
commentsCount: but I have yet to play with anyone so I can't honestly say how well that handles.\n\nYou can also change the color and sprite (albeit a minimal change) of your character which is also a rather nice feature. The detail on the boss sprites is incredible and you can really get a feel of the "grotesque alien mutation look" they were going for. My only complaint when it comes to the enemy design is that certain enemies look pretty lackluster
column16: like the eyeball enemies in the first 2nd and 3rd stages in particular.\n\nGameplay wise
column17: the controls feel solid and precise and can be adjusted to suit just about any taste. You can even adjust your x and y axis which is somewhat rare for a side scroller. The level designs flow well
column18: and you have a pretty decent chance to see what's trying to kill you before it gets a chance. There are 3 levels of difficulty and there's a significant difference between the 3. I don't recommend you play on normal alone unless you have VERY good reflexes or you're a glutton for pinishment. Boss patterns change with difficulty so there's an incentive to replay in that regards.\n\nI recommend this game to fans of Contra or side scrollers in general. the price is right and it's quite fun."
column22: 47 of 49 people (96%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
This game is maximum badass to the maximum. As someone who has played way too much Super C on NES, this game has some guts. I found this game on Recently Released page when the game got released. At first it looked like any other random indie scrubbity scrub but as the trailer went on and showed the gameplay, it was pretty clear that I have to try this right away.

Super Cyborg has some heavy inspiration from Super C (or Probotector 2, since our heroes are robots) which is a good thing for my point of view due Super C did improve the game in so many ways compared to original NES Contra. Better jump physics, top down levels, mid-bosses and non-spread weapons are actually powerful. This is exactly what Super Cyborg has but with some extra spice on it.

You can for example lock your position so you can shoot any direction you want without moving. This is insanely handy when you want to fire diagonally without running back and fourth for example when fighting against stationary turrets. Super Cyborg also has an ability to charge your weapon (it has own button for it) which adds some damage to the shot. Pretty useful against bosses to get that accurate damage going.

Speaking of bosses, there are two types of bosses in this game. There are bosses that are trial and error and there are bosses that actually requires you to be awake and focus on the battle. While trial and error bosses aren't too nice, they are definitely much better than Super C bosses that were insanely boring and easily the weakest point of the game.

This game also supports online co-op which is very nice. Unfortunately I only have one friend that won't lose all his lives on the first level and he lives at the other side of the globe which this game does not like at all. I highly recommend getting a friend that is pretty close to you (read: region) to enjoy online co-op the fullest.

Super Cyborg is a great game, but it won't get a perfect score from me. There are some areas in the game that requires you to have a powerful weapon or you have going to have insanely bad time. Good example is the rolling corpse ball thing in final level. If you are unable to get the spread in there and you have playing with default gun instead, it gets insanely tricky since you can't hit the ball diagonally unless you are about to get hit by it. It could be me just being bad but any powerup before that section would be nice.

One of the features I would like to see in this game is the ability to go back to level 1 from the game over screen. In Super C the game goes back to title screen after 3 game overs but in order to start all over again in Super Cyborg, you have to go back to the menu and then make a new game which takes a bit more time than just pressing Restart Game" or something. I find it a good way to try perfecting earlier levels and get prepared for later levels better.

I'm actually amazed how Super Cyborg hasn't gotten any showlight from Steam. People don't even know this game is being sold in Steam which is a real bummer. Super Cyborg is a hidden
date: rough looking gem and while apparently it has been out in Desura for some time
recommended: it was my personal GOTY for 2015.\n\nSo do I recommend this game to you? If you have played too much Contra/Super C
hoursPlayed: this is a must buy. Don't even think about it
voteText: go for it. For everybody else
helpfulPercent: you can download a demo and try it. It's a difficult game but success always will be rewarded."

reviewText: Only 15 minutes in, and I can already tell that this game is a really fun Contra clone. It has all of its mechanics (one-hit deaths, variety of weapons, etc.), puts it in a more futuristic setting with freaky-looking alien enemies and throws in online multiplayer (as well as local MP, just like the good ol' days). reviewText: Super Cyborg is a very polished Contra-styled arcade run and gun shooter. It controls identical to Contra in terms of movement, shooting, and jump physics. Level design is also extremely reminiscient of Contra.\n\nSuper Cyborg plays really well, with lots of very varied level and boss designs. It's playstyle is much closer to the older Contra's, as it emphasizes platforming and constantly moving forward over the boss rush" style gameplay of later titles (see: Hardcorps
recommended: and many Treasure titles). I found this refreshing
hoursPlayed: since I like the constant push forward in older titles.\n\nIt is much harder then the older Contras however
voteText: and not in the way I would have liked. I'm an arcade game veteran who's 1 life cleared Ninja Gaiden
votesTotal: and I have to say that this game requires an absurd amount of memorization. Usually
votesFunny: I play these sorts of games on one credit
commentsCount: restarting from the beginning when I game over
column16: but this sort of playstyle is not feasible for Super Cyborg until you've learned the whole game. You need a plan and a route for every stage after the first 3
column17: so you'll definitely want to grind some of the stages for a while with unlimited continues if you want to clear this game.\n\nI'm also a bit more partial to challenges based on reflexes and improvisation. I always enjoyed Contra 1-3 and Ghouls and Ghosts because many of the enemy behaviors were extremly randomized and required on the spot reflexes instead of just planning. Super Cyborg has a few spots like this
column18: but it's much more static and memorization focused in general. If you like formulating plans and routes for strategic gameplay

reviewText:
Great game with greater difficulty. Super Cyborg is an action platformer in the vein of classics such as Contra. It requires quick reflexes but also patience because the difficulty as well as visual style are straight out of the S/NES playbook.

Tight controls, cruel deaths, evil levels & enemies and bosses you're gonna hate!
I really enjoyed the music and art too. It's recommended for those that can tolerate a difficult platformer, and by difficult i mean relentles. Paths and attacks can be memorised most of the time though there are a few enemies with random aim to throw the player off. Despite the onslaught of bullets and monsters to pay attention to, deaths very rarely feel cheap. Similarly to Volgarr the Viking, expect to repeat levels many times before becoming skilled enough to complete the game. And just completing one level feels like a big deal. Compared to Volgarr though, the pace of Super Cyborg is quicker, and difficulty maybe a touch easier. You'll still swear it's impossible many times.

I'm not very good at these games so i tend to hate them. Super Cyborg felt surprisingly encouraging. It's easy to play but everything kills in one hit so it's important to figure out how to deal with new enemies or sequences. The game stays fresh with new types of pain to put you through and even though i'd have to replay stages again and again, i was motivated to get through and see what the next pit of hell is gonna be like.

It's tough but fun, mostly because of really good gameplay/controls and a lack of repetitive elements. An excellent tribute to a different era that still feels good today. Well designed and polished, making an excellent use of the retro style. Sprinkled with evil.

reviewText:
To note, the first game I ever beat on one quarter and one life in the arcade was Contra.  I have enjoyed the Contra series until it moved to Playstation 1 and they started to go off the deep end by confusing collossal and impressive with cartoon comical.  Now, the arcade contra series had a particular nuance in the gun firing control which was interesting and frustrating at the same time.  The NES one- is the one that I believe truly put Contra on the map of every young person who owned the nintendo at that time.  Coop became a 'thing.'  Large bosses became a 'thing.'  Punishing one hit deaths and getting rick rolled by a game became a 'thing.'

Fast forward to this game:
This game has too many human looking eyeballs :P However, overlooking this, it is perfect and I mean perfect in the feel and control of the game to match and duplicate the Nintendo Contra.  Not the later series ones, but the solid NES control and feel.

The game has some of the BEST and imaginative boss fights in a side scrolling shooter I have ever played.  It is worth it to play through the game JUST to get to these fights.  Also be very glad the guns are all auto-fire- especially for the later stages and last bosses.  Unlike many of the Contra games, especially the arcade Super Contra, losing your power ups does not mean you cannot survive the game.  The default gun is great and has a solid ROF.

This game has coop and netplay.  What can I say here, this is excellent.

I will say that some elements of some of the levels are a bit bland and could use some enhancements.  However, you WILL overlook this as you go on further in the game.  Personally, level 3 was the least impressive to me and I WISH it had a lot more environmental terrors in it and that the mid boss played a bit differently.  This is minor though and borders on nitpicking haha

To sum up:
- excellent control, truly an inspired sequel to the first NES Contra titles (Contra and Super C), with some additions to control that make it pro player on every level (ability to fire at angles in a locked standing position for example).

Get this game, support the developers- I would love a sequel :D

reviewText:
I've been having trouble submitting long reviews as of late (I sure as hell wouldn't be able to submit that review here; it's over 3500 words long!), so for the time being I'm leaving longer reviews on Pastebin and posting a short summary of the review here. Here is the link to the long review http://pastebin.com/HYG05Ftd .

Gameplay: Pretty much more Contra with some neat bonus stuff, base gun is kinda really bad and useless for bosses, enemy variety is very good, bosses are usually pretty good albeit some pattern memorization here and there, stages 1-5 are good as far as content goes, stage six is lame because it's an overhead stage, stage 7 doesn't know when the hell to end, final boss is super backloaded as far as difficulty goes and is unfun to fight. Still very fun overall though, despite the game not knowing when to end. 8/10.

Story: Can be summed up in a single sentence; not worth reviewing.

Graphics: Art design is fantastic, game fullscreens to any native resolution without any hassle. 5/5.

Sound: OST is good but not incredibly memorable, sound design is par for the course for NES-like titles. 4/5.

8/0/5/4; 8.5/10.
voteText: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I find it difficult to not recommend Super Cyborg because it's obviously a work of passion and a tribute to the old NES title 'Super Contra'

The graphics are suitably retro though they tend more to the garish EGA colours than the more muted NES pallette.  Turning off filtering and blending options gives a very old school emulated look that I find appealing.  The sprites are chunky and what they lack in style they make up for in character.  Curiously in this day-and-age the game is locked to a 4:3 ratio screen which leaves the borders black.

The music is generally good and has a remixed contra vibe going.  It doesn't quite have the presence of a lot of the late 80s games and as such is fairly forgettable; but this is not a significant criticism as it still suits the game.  The sound effects are very similar to Super Contra but - again - miss something vital and don't quite feel 'there'.

My biggest gripe is with the gameplay.  It's punishingly difficult in the later stages.  A frustration that's exacabated by the lack of a quick restart button.  Miss or lose a power up and that's the point at which the stage is failed, everything afterwards is just killing the player.

It's made more frustrating by a myriad of small differences from Super Contra.  Things that should have been fixed during playtesting.  The enemy bullets move too fast and being purple / yellow are difficult to spot agains purple or yellow backgrounds.  There are cheap deaths near the borders of the screen: enemies spawn underneath the player or shoot from outside the edges.

Couple this with a lack of checkpoints in some very long stages and it's time to start throwing controllers.

The controls are classic Contra though the player moves a bit more slowly than in the original.  The gun doesn't angle correctly up inclined platforms but this is hardly a problem.  What is a problem is that analogue controls on game controllers do not work; there is no diagonal fire with the analogue sticks.

To wrap this up.  If you're feeling nostalgic and want to mess around in a Super Contra like game for a couple of hours then buy Super Cyborg.  If you're looking for a platformer like Gryzor, Contra or Turrican then approach with caution; Super Cyborg is too frustrating to scratch that itch.
voteText: 20 of 37 people (54%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
It's the proper Contra sequel Konami doesn't want to make anymore.
You've got all the Super C weapons, the charge shot from Shattered Soldier and the ability to hold in place with a button like every game since Alien Wars (you can even change it to be like Hard Corps if for some weird reason you preferred it that way)
The difficulty is exactly what you would expect from a game like this and I never felt cheated by the game whenever I died, it was always a dumb mistake or not paying attention. I've seen people complain that you are helpless once you lose a special weapon but that is not the case at all, the default weapon is incredibly powerful when used properly.
There is a single minor flaw to the game: when you're on a slope and you shoot diagonally the aim will not realign itself to be at the proper angle like it does in every Contra game. I find it weird that the developer who obviously loves the series as much as he does could forget something like that but again it's a minor thing and its absense is only noticeable in a couple of spots.

If you've been craving some more Contra then you need this game.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Greatest Contra clone/Spiritual sequel. It takes a lot from both Contra & Super C with a spice of HardCorps and Shattered Soldier. The overall level design follows the Super C template with a little bit of HC influence as you will be facing bosses about 2 or 3 times a stage. the Shattered Soldier influence comes with the chargeable weapon which gives a strategic element to know which weapon to use at what time and when it is better to simply tap'n'leave with a Charge shot rather than fire at will. The patterns for the bosses are mostly inspired by HC, which feel a bit unbalanced at times since you don't have the abilities needed, but it comes out as a NES-Hard difficulty where you either man up and do a perfect run or you simply won't make it. The last boss is incredibly hard. I'd recommend this game in a Heartbeat to any old-school Contra fan, especial√±ly if you liked Contra/Super C/Hardcorps/Shattered Soldier over any other installment.

TL;DR If you're an oldschool Contra fan, you better get this game immediately (it is currently bundled for 1.99 on bundlestars and is frequently bundled in other bundle sites as well)

9/10 Would Lock n' Load and Attack Aggressively again.

reviewText: Super Game! Super hard game, even harder then Super Contra :D

A clone of classic Contra games but a bit harder.

The way of how the cyborgs move, how they jump, run, shoot and even die, all of the animation presents the same like in the old time, so does the feedback when you press a button to make any move.

Since it is a clone, the graphic is definitely old-school styled. With better hardware support nowadays, it displays more colors and details. The music is well composed in classic ways.

Also, a little surprise for players when finishing the game.

If you like classic Contra on NES and SNES, this game is a must-have for you.
A gaming controller is really recommended.

This Contra clone is pretty fun, and has cool enemies and bosses. There are a few problems at the time of writing, however. First off, there is an overhead level where it is boring and plays like molassas. Secondly, this game follows the annoying all too common and nearly impossible steam achievement beat the game without dying". Another problem is that the first players score resets when you game over

reviewText: The most beautiful and smooth Contra clone I've ever played. The style of the game is based mostly off of the NES Contra games, but uses Contra 3 firing rules (every weapon is autofire, so no blistered thumbs) with an extra weapon charge button like Contra: Shattered Soldier. Lets you choose between BOTH types of player locking (The one from Contra 3+Contra 4+ Contra ReBirth where you hold the button, but also has the toggleable lock from Shattered Soldier if you really want to use that garbage). The laser weapon is kind of a mixture of Contra 3 and Contra 4's laser, so it isn't underpowered. Most enemies are weird and mutated things that look like something out of Contra Hard Corps. This game really tries to combine all contra games into one experience, and even has local co-op and netplay. My one complaint is that you can't jump down off of platforms (down+jump).\n\nBy the way, if and when you get this game, go straight into options and immediately turn smoothing off, because it looks awful.

reviewText:
Contra gameplay + Grotesque Enemies = You better get this game!!!!

Although there are some issues:

1. Stage 5 boss: It's extremely difficult dodging these damn fireballs when your character is so slow.
2. Infinite spawning enemies (especially when started around Stage 3) gets extremely annoying.
3. Stage 7 boss is extremely unfair in its 2nd form. Not only ae you trying to destroy the adhesive tentacle, you also have to dodge the acid tears, and boogers, while trying to expose its weak spot.


There are other things but overall I give it a solid 9/10

reviewText:
A Contra/Probotector-clone that completely drops the ball in terms of balance, learning curve, difficulty and leveldesign past the third level. On easy-mode, mind you.

Ball busting hard for all the wrong reasons, your character is too slow and cumbersome to move to dodge the streams of projectiles or keep the hordes of enemies swarming the screen at bay. Firerate and weapon-power are kinda weak and not really fit to level the playing field between you and the attacking alien scum that take way too much damage. Gravitation while jumping feels weird, almost floaty - the midair-spinning feels off. And the leveldesign is made for autistic people that know the exact positions and hit/hurtboxes of basically everything. It's so bad, that you can basically reset the later stages if you lost / missed a weapon power-up unless you are a japanese arcade god, because there is no coming back from that otherwise.

I imagine this game was playtested with two players in mind, but even with a COOP-buddy it demands a level of precision and dedication that is insanely high - and to be frank, I don't think the game is rewarding enough to spent that serious amount of time on it.

The weird / disturbing visuals realized in a most garish way (imagine the worst palettes from Mega Drive, NES and MS-DOS era EGA mashed together) and a soundtrack that doesn't quite get me psyched for the action do not help the case of Super Cyborg.

Game could have been THE BOMB - instead it's a brutal and punishing clone that doesn't get fundamental things right and also takes way too long in the second half (seriously, those stages toward the end of the game would easily be two or more levels in an actual old-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• run & gun).

If you want a stupidly hard and frustrating, poor-mans Contra - congratulations, you found it. But people that are looking for a genuine golden age" Run & Gun affair can skip Super Cyborg and won't be missing much. Not recommended and very disappointed."

reviewText:
I would really like to recommended this game as it a great Contra-clone.
Both the controls and graphics nail the overall feel of the first two entries in the Contra series.
However, it is far too difficult for its own good.
Unless you have patience and time to spare, do not bother, or all you'll get from this game is an endless amount of frustration.

reviewText: Well, it's a lot like Contra. A bit too much, I think; it's the same one hit-per-life gameplay where the best strategy is just deleting enemies as soon as they run onto the screen, and getting hit leaves you with the default machine gun, and usually in a bad way as a result. If you really liked Contra it's probably quite fun but if you didn't it doesn't seem to have any modern changes.

reviewText:
It's a contra clone, but very cheaply done.  I love the oringal NES contra, great design, great challenges and smooth and very well excuted.

This on the other hand has some bad issues that keeps throwing me out of the contra nastalgia.  First is the framerate...at time it's really smooth, but mostly it's just not.  It goes from what appears to be low fps, that's hard on the eyes, to sometimes a bit choppy, all sorts of really bad stuff done, in a game with low end graphics.  Just feels like as powerful as my computer is, this shouldn't happen.  I also tried changing all sorts of settings, they didn't do anything, except make the game look and feel even worse.

Shooting...well, my biggest gripe on this, is when you go up and down diagonal platforms...while trying to shoot up/down them.  At times your bullets all go into the ground, other times, he shoots directly over everyone's head.  Very frustrating.  It's like the bullets have a set path, and the ground just doesn't match...which just makes me wish they never put diagonal type pathing.

Design...well, I liked the original's diversity.  In here, they kind of did mostly right scrolling.  The one that was kind of top down, well, it felt like they forgot about it so rushed it into one place.  Even the platforming felt forgotten.  IMO, it just felt like they didn't particularily care about the design.

Of course, all that said, it's not like they're asking a lot of money for this game...however, all this game made me really want to do was load up an emulator and play the classic again.

reviewText: This game is not for everyone! It's for fans of the Contra type of game and of the old school arcade way of difficulty. If you can't find joy in repeating levels over and over with unlimited continues and lots of trial and error, then this might be not for you.\nI actually find the game okayish but want to even out the overall very good score by giving it a thumbs down. As I said, the game is not for everyone and it also has its flaws, so I guess it's fair. Paid as much as I would have put into it if it was an arcade machine, which is also fair.

reviewText:
Pros:
-Nostalgia
-Nice soundtrack from Darkman007

Cons:
-Too frustrating and unbalanced after stage 2
-Characters are too slow
-Color palette too confusing
-Some bosses are too strong and long, even on Easy setting
-Should have some checkpoints
-Should have more types of shots and power ups
-There is not enough reaction time, meaning it is necessary to memorize the stages and do them over and over again, always with 2 players. If you die or lose a powerup, restart the level
-The charging shots are  useless

On the first 10 minutes you will think Yay! It's Contra!"

Highly recommended for lovers of action-packed retro sidescrollers and especially Contra fans.

In addition there are some features which regard the comfort like changing the resolution and input configuration freely.

The game looks and feels like Contra/Probotector series, with really nice music, graphics and gameplay! :D

I just played for 15 minutes, and I felt the urge to share my happiness here! :D

I'll update this review when I finish the game ;)

This game is great! Everything reminds me of Contra: animations, weapons, power-ups, enemy AI, etc.
The difficulty is high but i enjoy this.

Recommended!

AKA Contra 5. Seriously, Konami, hire these people.
It's like being 10 again and playing Gryzor with a buddy in front of a NES and a CRT TV, except now I'm over 30 and playing in a big-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• monitor, using a 360 controller and skype to play from far away.
The graphics are crisp and well defined, the color pallete is MegaDrive-ish (on purpose I guess?), but the scenery is well defined and you won't have problems telling whats going on. Music is great if you like 8/16-bit chiptunes and the sound effects are adequate (not annoying and give you clues to what's going on).
The Difficulty is HARD. I haven't tried on Easy, but in Normal, you will die and continue again and again. But through the power of memorization, old school skills, muscle reflex and sheer willpower, you can overcome every level (Some design choices for the levels are downright sadistic, though). It is highly recommended to play it with a buddy, either local or netplay (it's just more fun, and it's relatively easier).

Do you like Contra? Do you like Run 'N Gun games like Contra, Metal Slug, Turrican, Gunstar Heroes and Journey to Silious?

BUY. THIS. GAME.

The controls are perfect. The graphics are wonderfully retro. It's Contra-hard. And it works with just about any controller, you do not have to futz around with a 360 controller emulator or Xpadder. And it's an f'n steal at $4.99.

BUY THIS NOW.

Dare I say, Super Cyborg is as good as Contra.

If you enjoy classic run 'n' gun gameplay, pick this up, grab a buddy (local or online) and use them as a meat shield... you'll need it.

Note: The only issue I had with the game was the default controller options (my controllers weren't showing up in-game). Just use joytokey if you find yourself in the same boat.
Do you like Contra and Super Contra on NES?  This sure feels like it.  It even has it's own extra lives code.

Overall looks great, same as playing a Contra (more like the first Contra and Super C) but a lot harder than Contra.
But I have to admit, even I play a lot of retro style Run'n' Gun but this on is so hard. Especially the last boss.

Buy it if you like Contra or retro style Run'n' Gun games, this game is really worth for you

PS. I like the soundtrack of Final Stage, that's remind me of Super C's stage 6 soundtrack.

I found this game after listening to a Super Contra remix of Stage 1's music and a long-play video of Super Cyborg was listed on the right of the page. So, I decided to buy it and give it a shotl. This game absolutely rocks. One nice feature in particular is the Automatic Save feature that saves your progress after each stage.

If you've played Contra, Super Contra, Contra 3, Hard Corps, etc... you should feel right at home with Super Cyborg. The gameplay mechanics are very close to the same with a few new features packed in such as the Alternate Fire Mode for each weapon.

Now, I wish I had an NES (or even a Super NES) controller with a USB adapter to play the game with. But, that's ok.

Contra III pales compared to this, its the best Contra or Probotector clone available for just $5!!!!! This is well worth $25!!!! Superb well done!

A wonderful Contra clone. Crisp NES style graphics, upbeat chiptune sound track and perfectly simple controls. I also want to thank the developer for including the option to remap the controls, it's mindboggling to me how many devs do not do this. I am a retro gamer who uses an X-Arcade controler so being able to remap controls are very important to me and I was excited to discover this is one more classic game I can add to my arcarde setup.
very cool contra clone

This is a spiritual successor to Super C, if you're a diehard Contra fan, you should get this game by all means!!

I hope Contra the Movie will happen despite Konami is now focusing on gambling machines and mobile games.

If you like Contra or want to try your hands on a cool neoretro shooter, Super Cyborg has you covered! Very well done, rather challenging and extremly faithful to the era and games that inspired it. Just beware that this may include some of the quirks of the day that you don't tend to see in modern titles.\n\nGot it as a part of a package deal, so I haven't spent that much time with Super Cyborg. Consequently, I never finished it so I don't know how much content there really is. The game's levels are pretty brief though, so if you like it there's good replayability to be had as the occasional action moment in your day.

A wonderful tribute to Contra, tough but not impossible, and rewarding gameplay. I'm only on Level 3 at the moment but the vibrant feel of the 16-BIT shoot 'em-up era is well and truly alive here! A must play for anyone with nostalgic memories of Contra who want a new challenge in the same mould. Highly recommended for all levels of playnig ability.

First of all, I did not play the original Contra games and I had to learn the mechanics 100% from scratch.
It was worth it. I was worried about the game, but after spending 6 hours I finally made it to the last boss... ON EASY. Truly a challenge for me and I plan to continue on the harder difficulties. I absolutely recommend this game to anyone that loves difficulty and Punishment (Except level 4, **** that level).

Having a friend to enjoy it with makes it even more challenging and fun and for $5, that's possible.
Feel like <Contra>, with harder difficulty and more rage quits, but still u wanna play more.\nThat's enough.
